page.title: 15Flod Prevention Scheme
page.content: In February 1984 there was a council meeting in Dumfries. The meeting was about the flooding in the burn at Springholm, as several houses were being flooded each year. Four months later the Flood prevention scheme got under way. The cost was to be Â£150,000 excluding the hire of diggers which was Â£900. They were going to start work on the burn as it came to the first flooded houses, (across from the Primary School). The workmen started work by damming the burn about 500 yards from a Miss Malia's. Then the banks were straightened and wire cages were placed in, full of rocks. Then they put a net over the bottom of the burn. The cages went on for about 500 yards on one side and 600 yards on the other side.
